answers.answer: I would talk to your obgyn or a fertility doctor.. i also have pcos (and many other fertility "challenges") we were unable to get pregnant initially without help.. Also most people with PCOS that have trouble getting pregnant, get put on an oral drug called metformin - its a diabetes pill, but helps the insulin resistance of pcos.. i didnt' have insulin resistance, but took the metformin anyways (it couldnt hurt, just help!) and we are 29 weeks pregnant.. Good luck, the good news is that you know what the issue is and there are very simple fixes for it! : )

question: i was told i have pocs, and it really stress me out. i had monthly period before i went on the combine pill for over a year an a half, when i came off the pill i miss my period of six months, since then its been Irregular since then.i have been in a relationship for over 4 years, and we been trying of a baby for 10 months an we have no succes. what can we do?
title: pregnancy
